Description: Complete scarab, made of egyptian blue paste. The division between head and prothorax is indicated by a line as is the division between prothorax and elytra. The suture is shown by a single line as well. The head is of a trapezoidal shape, no eyes are visible. The clypeus is shown with one notch in the middle and two framing lines. The side of the scarab shows three carved legs on each side, without details, sitting on top of the base plate. The seal at the base shows an thin oval line framing the base that is rubbed off at one "corner". Inside a lying lion facing to the right, above his back a sun disc. The orientation of the sealing is longitunidal as is the perforation.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2 M (in door)
